title: User Management Controller
description:
Implement User Management Controller with CRUD, Password, and Status Operations

Create a comprehensive user management controller that handles complete user lifecycle operations including creation, retrieval, updates, deletion, password management, and account status changes.

Requirements:

User CRUD Operations:
- Create new user accounts with proper validation (email format, required fields, uniqueness constraints)
- Retrieve user information (single user by ID, list users with pagination/filtering)
- Update user profile data (name, email, preferences) with validation
- Delete user accounts (consider soft vs hard delete strategy)

Password Management:
- Implement secure password creation with strength requirements (minimum length, complexity rules)
- Hash passwords using industry-standard algorithms (bcrypt, argon2)
- Provide password reset functionality with secure token generation
- Support password change for authenticated users (verify old password first)
- Never expose passwords in responses or logs

Status Management:
- Enable/disable user accounts (active, suspended, banned states)
- Track status change history with timestamps and reasons
- Prevent operations on inactive accounts with appropriate error messages
- Support bulk status updates if needed

Security & Validation:
- Validate all inputs to prevent injection attacks
- Implement proper authorization checks (users can only modify their own data unless admin)
- Rate limit sensitive operations (password reset, account creation)
- Return appropriate HTTP status codes and error messages

Error Handling:
- Handle duplicate email/username attempts
- Handle invalid user IDs gracefully
- Provide clear, user-friendly error messages without exposing system details
- Log errors appropriately for debugging

Testing Considerations:
- Unit tests for each endpoint
- Test edge cases (invalid data, missing fields, unauthorized access)
- Test password hashing and verification
- Test status transitions and access control
